summary: This is an email chain from January 2019 regarding maintenance issues with security cameras at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The correspondence discusses a down camera in the medical waiting area and broader delays in a camera replacement/upgrade project, indicating ongoing facility management concerns at the federal prison where Jeffrey Epstein was later held.

persons.name: Enera Oremaw
persons.context: Signs off on the email as the Acting Facility Manager at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, discussing camera maintenance and project delays.

events.title: Camera #76 Communication Problem Reported
events.description: An initial report is made that Camera #76 for the Medical Waiting Area at the Metropolitan Correctional Center has a communication problem.

events.title: Follow-up on Camera Issues and Project Delays
events.description: An email follow-up discusses the ongoing camera issue, notes a staff elevator is down, mentions a lack of recent reports on down cameras, and states the facility is waiting on a vendor to fulfill a large equipment order for camera replacement and upgrades.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, NY (inferred from address format)
keyFacts: The document is internal facility management correspondence from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in early January 2019.
It reveals ongoing maintenance issues, including a specific down security camera (#76) in the medical waiting area and a non-functional staff elevator.
It references a significant, delayed project to replace existing cameras and add new ones, with the facility waiting on vendor equipment.
The correspondence highlights potential security system vulnerabilities at the federal prison where Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated and died months later in July 2019.
